dhamma-poems/cleans-away-all-darkness.ht.title: Cleans away all darkness
dhamma-poems/cleans-away-all-darkness.ht.description: Across the stars, Down to earth, In the heart, Truth be heard.This day was dark, But dawning light, Tis the Buddhas Words, That give us practice's sight, Feet on the Path, is our True fight.Not to fear, No lonely heart, The Dhammas real, It takes out the dart.Mara's hordes, Have no chance to keep us caught. So we are to break the bonds, Of worldly toil.The luminous heart, that virtue brings, Generous and bright That goodness sings.For here we tread and toil, With all our might to bear. Tis the Buddhas realm of wisdoms, That is beyond all compare.So let no darkness bind us, Let no ignorance hold. For upright Truth, will be found withinus, When we give our all.Let not fear, nor sloth, nor idleness creep in, The light of the sun, is like the Buddhas sphere.To tame and point the way, that's The Teachers Mark, All those beings will to Train, Give-up to the Magnificent One.Tis possible that we might be weak at times, But if we recall the taste of Wisdom and Peace that has been felt We will know the way, and know right friends true.Best of friends is the Buddha, Best of friends is Dhamma True, Best of friends are those who well practiced, Best of friends is our inward proper use.Setup the light in the heart of Darkness, Keep it bright and clear, Let the Dhamma guide us, Beyond the snares and traps of Mara's lair.No matter the deceptions, Not matter if upset, Put down all Wrong Views promptly, Give up the the Higher Quest.Rightly forward one foot forward, Rightly on breath True. All conditions known as just temporary, The stigmata show us the Deathless Way.So each must bridge over this inner darkness, Each must tread with care and light. That the Way be followed, That brings true practice and insight.Don't be deceived by a culture, Don't follow shadows of decay, Just be a spiritual warrior, for following totally the Buddhas Way.So now to see the water, That Nibbana's End is true, Countless Eons no more needed, If we give our life in earnest use.Without resolve we can not go forward, Without forgiveness we cannot no peace, Without tranquillity no solitude will help us, Without Wisdom, no end can we meet.So give up to the world of the practice, Don't believe our own views and thoughts are right, Like sliver and gold, doth dross come, So purity shall be ones spiritual might.Cleans away all darkness, Wash away wrong views, Brighten up all precepts, So one is like the shinning full moon.

dhamma-poems/to-know-true-peace.html.title: To Know True Peace
dhamma-poems/to-know-true-peace.html.description: Beyond the darkness, Beyond the blue, The heart of Dhamma, Is so True.True to kindness, True to care, Built on Lord Buddhas wisdom, The power of his compassionate welfare.Tis ardour in practice, Gumption in peace, Recollecting good action, Ending mental disease.... No names can then bind us, ... No signs can sway our hold, Perfect in Sīla, Perfect in Resolve. No matter the barrier, No matter the lair, Mara will not hold us, For the Well-Farer’s, Teachings are close to bear.Aligning in that goodness, Waking up to inner strength, Enduring patiently all contact, The silent heart is best.Whatever shackles bind us, The Teacher taught all worldly flaws. Overcoming our own weakness, Recollect the Dhamma Ever-more.Sati is the light force, Sīla the inner guide, Saddhā sparks that courageous endeavour, & Paññā brings Mara’s demise.No matter what the world says, No matter how we feel, The Teacher Taught us earnestness, That it be imbued in the fabric of our weal.From this brick & mortar, From this blood & bones, All lust and covetousness abandoned, All anger and hatred without a home.Greatness in peacefulness our station, Greatness in fortitude our zeal, From this skeleton of action, The Kinsman of the Sun; Shows us the Path that is Real.Real to Right Intention, Real to the 8 fold Path, No matter the time of practice, Ardour and splendour the Buddha's disciples art.Persietence and patient endevour, Building up the causes day and night, Living up to our station of existence, Disciples of the Tathāgata, Blessed in practice's light.Meditation on the loathsome, Holding to each breath, Death, decay at any moment, Extinction of suffering Best.So may we flow forward with the Dhamma, The ocean, Nibbana's edge.

map-of-dhamma-notes.html.title: Map of Dhamma Notes
map-of-dhamma-notes.html.description:
To Know True Peace
Cleans away all darkness

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. Multiple values will be tried in order until one succeeds. Multiple values will not insert this feature multiple times.

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. Multiple values will be tried in order until one succeeds. Multiple values will not insert this feature multiple times.

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the closer connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make the graph appear more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. Multiple values will be tried in order until one succeeds. Multiple values will not insert this feature multiple times.

info_includePath.description: The path on the server from which this feature can be loaded

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded
